details:
Several vulnerabilities were fixed in the Wireshark network
protocol analyzer.


* [CVE-2019-10894](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-10894)
GSS-API dissector crash
* [CVE-2019-10895](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-10895)
NetScaler file parser crash
* [CVE-2019-10896](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-10896)
DOF dissector crash
* [CVE-2019-10899](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-10899)
SRVLOC dissector crash
* [CVE-2019-10901](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-10901)
LDSS dissector crash
* [CVE-2019-10903](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-10903)
DCERPC SPOOLSS dissector crash
* [CVE-2019-12295](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12295)
Dissection engine could crash


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
2.6.8-1.1~deb9u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your wireshark packages.


For the detailed security status of wireshark please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/wireshark>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
